meanings.definition: One who opposes or resists something.
meanings.sent1: The opposer disagreed with the new rule.
meanings.sent2: The opposer stood firm against the proposed changes.
meanings.sent3: The opposer playfully argued against having dessert before dinner.
meanings.sent4: She was like an opposer of the wind, always pushing back.
meanings.sent5: The opposer was like a rock in the river, steadfast and unyielding.

meanings.definition: To act against or provide resistance to something.
meanings.sent1: She will opposer the plan to build a new road.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to opposer the decision made by the coach.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to opposer getting a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: His determination to opposer the storm was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The tree roots opposer the growth of the nearby plants, competing for space.
